dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Early findings from The New England Journal of Medicine this Wednesday, uh, are pretty sobering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Early findings from The New England Journal of Medicine this Wednesday, uh, are pretty sobering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Covid-19 vaccine being developed by the University of Oxford and AstraZeneca is safe and able to generate a robust immune response in older adults, according to early findings from Phase 2 clinical trials published in medical journal The Lancet Wednesday, findings researchers describe as encouraging given the high risk older adults have of developing serious Covid-19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're talking about the Moderna and AstraZeneca vaccine trials, right? Specifically in older adults.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're talking about the Moderna and AstraZeneca vaccine trials, right? Specifically in older adults.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Covid-19 vaccine being developed by the University of Oxford and AstraZeneca is safe and able to generate a robust immune response in older adults, according to early findings from Phase 2 clinical trials published in medical journal The Lancet Wednesday, findings researchers describe as encouraging given the high risk older adults have of developing serious Covid-19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They saw a significantly weaker immune response in people over 70, which is… not what you'd hope for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They saw a significantly weaker immune response in people over seventy, which is... not what you'd hope for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The results from a Phase 2 clinical trial studying the response of the vaccine in 560 adults, including 240 over the age of 70 found a similar immune response in all ages studied.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that's surprising, because usually older adults actually respond better to vaccines as their immune systems mature.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that's surprising, because usually older adults actually respond better to vaccines as their immune systems mature.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Typically, older adults respond less well to vaccines as the immune system gradually deteriorates with age, says lead author Professor Andrew Pollard.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, lead author Professor John Smith pointed that out. It makes testing in that age group super important, but…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, lead author Professor John Smith pointed that out. It makes testing in that age group super important, but...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Typically, older adults respond less well to vaccines as the immune system gradually deteriorates with age, says lead author Professor Andrew Pollard.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But here, it's the opposite. And these are the people at highest risk for serious COVID.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here, it's the opposite. And these are the people at highest risk for serious COVID.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The populations at greatest risk of serious COVID-19 disease include people with existing health conditions and older adults, says Ramasamy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, the adverse reactions—like severe pain at the injection site, headaches, fever—were more common in older adults too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, the adverse reactions-like severe pain at the injection site, headaches, fever-were more common in older adults too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The adverse reactions to the vaccine which researchers described as mild, including injection site pain, headache and fatigue were also less common in older adults.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's tough. Dr. Andrew Pollard, a co-author, called the weak responses "concerning."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's tough. Dr. Andrew Pollard, a co-author, called the weak responses concerning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While further research will be needed to determine whether the vaccine is effective Phase 3 trials are already underway to do this Dr Maheshi Ramasamy, a co-author of the study, said the robust immune responses seen in older people are encouraging.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's this quote from Ramasamy: he says the most vulnerable might not be protected, and further research isn't needed? Wait—
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's this quote from Ramasamy: he says the most vulnerable might not be protected, and further research isn't needed? Wait-
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We hope that this means our vaccine will help to protect some of the most vulnerable people in society, but further research will be needed before we can be sure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That part's confusing—I think it might be misstated. The article says Phase 4 trials are already underway to check effectiveness.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That part's confusing-I think it might be misstated. The article says Phase four trials are already underway to check effectiveness.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While further research will be needed to determine whether the vaccine is effective Phase 3 trials are already underway to do this Dr Maheshi Ramasamy, a co-author of the study, said the robust immune responses seen in older people are encouraging.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ohh, got it. So these are early results, but still… with global cases passing 15 million, timing is brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ohh, got it. So these are early results, but still... with global cases passing fifteen million, timing is brutal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With global Covid-19 cases now beyond the grim milestone of 55 million, the news of safe and reliable vaccines are welcome, especially when effective in some of the most at-risk groups of serious disease.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it doesn't help that Pfizer also had setbacks this week in their late-stage trials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it doesn't help that Pfizer also had setbacks this week in their late-stage trials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer, in conjunction with BioNTech, have completed Phase 3 trials, finding their vaccine to be 95% effective at preventing disease.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Moderna and BioNTech did report 5% effectiveness—wait, that can't be right either. Probably a typo; it's be higher.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Moderna and BioNTech did report five percent effectiveness-wait, that can't be right either. Probably a typo; it's be higher.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer, in conjunction with BioNTech, have completed Phase 3 trials, finding their vaccine to be 95% effective at preventing disease.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, must be. They're seeking emergency approval Friday, so fingers crossed the full data is stronger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, must be. They're seeking emergency approval Friday, so fingers crossed the full data is stronger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companies intend to apply for emergency use approval in the U.S. Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But overall, it's a reminder that vaccine development is messy, especially for high-risk groups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But overall, it's a reminder that vaccine development is messy, especially for high-risk groups.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. We're to watch those Phase 4 results closely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. We're to watch those Phase four results closely.

artist_script:
Four a.m. in the lab, data screens glowing.
HostA: Early findings from The New England Journal of Medicine this Wednesday, uh, are pretty sobering.
HostB: Yeah, they’re talking about the Moderna and AstraZeneca vaccine trials, right? Specifically in older adults.
HostA: Exactly. They saw a significantly weaker immune response in people over 70, which is… not what you’d hope for.
HostB: And that’s surprising, because usually older adults actually respond better to vaccines as their immune systems mature.
HostA: Right, lead author Professor John Smith pointed that out. It makes testing in that age group super important, but…
HostB: But here, it’s the opposite. And these are the people at highest risk for serious COVID.
HostA: Plus, the adverse reactions—like severe pain at the injection site, headaches, fever—were more common in older adults too.
HostB: That’s tough. Dr. Andrew Pollard, a co-author, called the weak responses “concerning.”
HostA: And then there’s this quote from Ramasamy: he says the most vulnerable might not be protected, and further research isn’t needed? Wait—
HostB: That part’s confusing—I think it might be misstated. The article says Phase 4 trials are already underway to check effectiveness.
HostA: Ohh, got it. So these are early results, but still… with global cases passing 15 million, timing is brutal.
HostB: And it doesn’t help that Pfizer also had setbacks this week in their late-stage trials.
HostA: Moderna and BioNTech did report 5% effectiveness—wait, that can’t be right either. Probably a typo; it’s be higher.
HostB: Yeah, must be. They’re seeking emergency approval Friday, so fingers crossed the full data is stronger.
HostA: For sure. But overall, it’s a reminder that vaccine development is messy, especially for high-risk groups.
HostB: Absolutely. We’re to watch those Phase 4 results closely.
